subject: Re: [junit] Query regarding Regarding Mock Objects
msgSnippet: ... And sometimes programmers do silly things. I just wanted to know which it was. Sometimes the mere act of asking such a question makes the programmer think,
messageBody:
Chappell, Simon P wrote:

> >-----Original Message-----
> >From: J. B. Rainsberger [mailto:jbrains@...]
> >Sent: Thursday, March 18, 2004 9:45 AM
> >To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> >Subject: Re: [junit] Query regarding Regarding Mock Objects
>
> <snip>
>
> >By the way....
> >
> >> private String usrId = null;
> >
> >Why on Earth would you abbreviate "userId" to "usrId"?!?! To
> >save typing
> >ONE CHARACTER?!?! Wow.
>
> Sometimes there are corporate standards to be followed. Sometimes the
> humble corporate programmers get mandates from above, backed up by
> promises of "consequences" if any of the shiny new rules are broken. Sad
> but true. I've worked in some places where it's dangerous to be caught
> thinking.
>
> assertEquals(myEmployer, "nice people");

And sometimes programmers do silly things. I just wanted to know which
it was. Sometimes the mere act of asking such a question makes the
programmer think, "Wow, that /is/ silly."
--
J. B. Rainsberger,
Diaspar Software Services

Let's write software that people understand
